first_reasoning: We should allocate the full $10 million to the Consumer Products Division because a dedicated rapid‐innovation cell there offers the greatest upside: reigniting flat‐lined sales and recovering lost margins through tightly governed stage‐gate development and lean prototyping. With disciplined go/no‐go thresholds and an upside override for true breakthroughs, the Consumer team can deliver more transformative returns in two funding cycles than the incremental gains likely from Industrial’s steadier but slower growth.
second_reasoning: We’re directing the entire R&D budget to Consumer Products because its stalled sales and recent losses present the greatest opportunity for a transformational payoff. A dedicated rapid-innovation cell, strict stage-gate funding and lean prototyping will reignite growth far more dramatically than any incremental gains in Industrial, so we’re allocating all resources to Consumer and none to Industrial.
